creator: hubertus@groepper.com
text:
Similar for the default publication, btw., so I changed Subject of this bug
accordingly. For the default pub, I get a different "error" screen:
-
Dokument existiert nicht
Das angeforderte Dokument '/introduction.html' mit der ID '/introduction'
existiert nicht.
Dieses Dokument erstellen
NOTE: Please make sure that your content repository is configured correctly
within (local.)publication.xconf
-
The fact that it's bilingual is a minor matter on it's own. Difference to Blog
publication is the link to create the non-existant document and that there's no
stacktrace. Error handling seems more graceful than for blog pub.

/authoring/?lenya.usecase=ac.login&referrerQueryString= does not work, but
/authoring/<any-existing-page.html>?lenya.usecase=ac.login&referrerQueryString=
does.

I'm on rev 413939 w. Jetty/FF 1.5Win

Josias Thöny:

> Just a guess, but it might have something to do with recent changes to
> cocoon's WildcardHelper.

Yes, it looks like that is the problem. I sent a mail to dev@cocoon:

http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=xml-cocoon-dev&m=115070821619218&w=2
